intro: Coussarea leptoloba var. leptoloba, commonly known as the slender coussarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that contains several seeds.
